posts.post_content:
Although these days she's rather subpar back in the day she was one of the few good cards out of homelands.  
  
Anyone who complains about mythic rares these days needs to look at homelands, every card under U1 (what was rare for small sets then) was utter shit, you'd rip packs hoping for Serrated Arrows or Primal Order, and wouldn't cry when you opened her, Erron, or Seinger.
posts.html:

Posted By: kowrip (5/17/2010 2:14:50 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@zqft: Her ability doesn't target. Targetting normally only applies if the card uses that word or uses some sort of keyword ability that contains the target concept in it (Equip, Fortify, Enchant Creature).  
  
General comment: LOVE the art. I wish there were more art like this. I also wish she had true troll shroud, slightly better stats, cheaper cost, or just anything to make her more playable. I imagine a fun "Girl Fight" between her and [Drana, Kalastria Bloodchief](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Drana, Kalastria Bloodchief). Drana's power can't hurt AW. :-)
posts.html:
@zqft: Her ability doesn't target. Targetting normally only applies if the card uses that word or uses some sort of keyword ability that contains the target concept in it (Equip, Fortify, Enchant Creature).

Posted By: ohthecommotion (3/8/2010 10:19:32 AM)

posts.post_content:
Sorry, Majinara, I just don't see Everyone's Least Favorite Set as having many playable cards.  
  
An-Zerrin Ruins: Decent but I'd rather play [Engineered Plague](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Engineered Plague).  
Aysen Crusader: Cool with the update but still risky and generally overcosted.  
Baron Sengir: Maybe interesting in a casual tribal deck but still heavily overcosted.  
Broken Visage: Spendy and highly situational but does have its merits.  
Eron the Relentless: Was a champ back in the day but holding 3 mana for regen every time you attack when you could use it for burn is why he's not useful. Plus, he's a turn 8 creature without mana accel.  
Memory Lapse, Merchant Scroll, Primal Order, and Serrated Arrows: All are excellent cards and the only truly good cards from this godawful set.  
Autumn Willow: Was once queen, now, over-costed. [Troll Ascetic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Troll Ascetic) runs laps around her.  
Sengir Autocrat: Was once a very useful creature. Not so much any more. Still useful with [Hecatomb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hecatomb) and def... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Sorry, Majinara, I just don't see Everyone's Least Favorite Set as having many playable cards.

An-Zerrin Ruins: Decent but I'd rather play Engineered Plague.
Aysen Crusader: Cool with the update but still risky and generally overcosted.
Baron Sengir: Maybe interesting in a casual tribal deck but still heavily overcosted.
Broken Visage: Spendy and highly situational but does have its merits.
Eron the Relentless: Was a champ back in the day but holding 3 mana for regen every time you attack when you could use it for burn is why he's not useful. Plus, he's a turn 8 creature without mana accel.
Memory Lapse, Merchant Scroll, Primal Order, and Serrated Arrows: All are excellent cards and the only truly good cards from this godawful set.
Autumn Willow: Was once queen, now, over-costed. Troll Ascetic runs laps around her.
Sengir Autocrat: Was once a very useful creature. Not so much any more. Still useful with Hecatomb and def... (see all)

posts.post_content:
Wow. It's amazing how different the game become. Her power is strictly worse than Hexproof.  
  
G for 1/1 hexproof (actually you can get it for G/U hybrid)  
GG 2/3 (2/2 plus lose of one hexproof). Add 1 colorless 2-3 power 4 toughness. add legendary drawback  
  
Today she'd be 1GG for a legendary 4/4 hexproof.
posts.html:
